page.title: 06Fairs And Customs.
page.content: {FAIRS AND CUSTOMS A long time ago King Henrylll granted Midsomer Norton the right to hold a 2 day cattle fair.The High Street was lined with cattle pens and there were stalls and fairground rides.All children had a 2 day holiday.Through the years the fair has changed.There are galloping horses,helta-skelta and roundabouts-much quicker and more dangerous.Today the fair is held in a field and not the High Street.The Fete andannual Flower Show was held in the meadow where the Somervale Comprehensive is now sited.It was always on the first Saterday in September.Bands would play and different Societies would parade in their regalia.Our main fair today is our Carnival,with floats from all the surrounding towns.
